Installation and Quick Start¶

Hosting the Experiment Web Server

  1. Install Python 3 and Git.
  2. Navigate to desired folder in terminal to save the web server project.
  3. Run git clone http://git.seat.utulsa.edu/Labrys/Django-Testbed-Experiment-Site
  4. Run cd Django-Testbed-Experiment-Site
  5. Run python3 -m pip install -r requirements.txt

This should complete the installation of the required programs and libraries. The only package that’s modified is django-scheduler, and that is to support 12-hour time and associate events with experiments. To make these modifications, you’re going to want to do the following:

  1. You should have django-scheduler installed from the previous command as normal through pip. You do not have to do all the bower stuff, as jQuery and Bootstrap are in the project already as static files.
  2. Find where django-scheduler installed to. For me, it installed in the /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/schedule/ directory, but for other computers/OSes it may be different.
  3. Replace its contents with this. Make sure the directory structure is the same before and after.

Now you’re safe to run the website. To do so, do the following:

  1. Navigate back inside the Django-Testbed-Experiment-Site directory.
  2. Run cd python3 manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:portNumber where portNumber is the decimal number of the port you want to host the webserver on. Note: The IP 0.0.0.0 tells the program to host the server on the IP of the machine it is running on.
  3. Open a second terminal and navigate to the same directory.
  4. Run python3 manage.py process_tasks to start the background-tasks scheduler.

Congratulations! You now are hosting the web server for the heavy-trucking experiment testbed!

Setting up BeagleBones to Process Experiments

Note: This is assuming the BeagleBones have all the necessary libraries and that the testbed setup hasn't been changed. The original designated IP for the Logger is 129.244.254.21 (BeagleBone 21) and the BeagleBone connected to a Smart Sensor Simulator 2 is 129.244.254.22 (BeagleBone 22). This one was originally connected to a brake controller.

  1. Open a new terminal and SSH into the Logger using ssh ubuntu@129.244.254.21 and enter the password.
  2. Navigate to the script by using cd BeagleBone_21_Logger/
  3. Run python3 app.py
  4. In new terminal, SSH into BeagleBone 22 using ssh ubuntu@129.244.254.22 and enter the password.
  5. Navigate to the script by using cd BeagleBone\ 22/
  6. Run python3 app.py

Congratulations again! You should now both be hosting the web server and have the BeagleBones set up to receive experiments! You should have four seperate terminals, but now you're ready for a user to use your website and schedule an experiment.
